Key Match Events: Moore (1') and Wilson (3') scored in the first 4 minutes of the match
Brnovic (49') and Marusic (57') scored for Montenegro
Pre-Game Insights: Wales will be aiming to build on their draw against Turkey when they continue their 2024-25 UEFA Nations League campaign with a contest against Montenegro on Monday night.
Craig Bellamy's side picked up a welcome point in a 0-0 draw with Turkey last time out, while Montenegro opened their Group 4 League B challenge with a 2-0 defeat to Iceland.

The Brave Falcons would have been looking to get their Nations League challenge off to a winning start on Friday night, but they went down 2-0 to Iceland, which has put pressure on them to pick up a positive result here.
Post-Match Reflections: Wales won the match 2-1 against Montenegro.
Ampadu (2'), Williams (49'), Mepham (54'), James (90+4') were the players who received yellow cards for Wales.
The match marked Bellamy's first game in charge of the national side, and he will now be looking for his first win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Montenegro have not reported any injury concerns following their clash with Iceland.
Head coach Prosinecki is likely to resist the temptation to shuffle his pack, meaning that there should be another start in the final third of the field for Nikola Krstovic.
The match was played at Stadion Kraj Bistrice.
